verses.text: \sc And\sc* Solomon the son of David was strengthened in his kingdom, and the \sc Lord\sc* his God \add was\add* with him, and magnified him exceedingly.
Then Solomon spake unto all Israel, to the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and to the judges, and to every governor in all Israel, the chief of the fathers.

So Solomon, and all the congregation with him, went to the high place that \add was\add* at Gibeon; for there was the tabernacle of the congregation of God, which Moses the servant of the \sc Lord\sc* had made in the wilderness.
But the ark of God had David brought up from Kirjath-jearim to \add the place which\add* David had prepared for it: for he had pitched a tent for it at Jerusalem.
Moreover the brasen altar, that Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, had made, he put before the tabernacle of the \sc Lord\sc*: and Solomon and the congregation sought \add unto\add* it.
And Solomon went up thither to the brasen altar before the \sc Lord\sc*, which \add was\add* at the tabernacle of the congregation, and offered a thousand burnt offerings upon it.
In that night did God appear unto Solomon, and said unto him, Ask what I shall give thee.
And Solomon said unto God, Thou hast shewed great mercy unto David my father, and hast made me to reign in his stead.
Now, O \sc Lord\sc* God, let thy promise unto David my father be established: for thou hast made me king over a people like the dust of the earth in multitude.
Give me now wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in before this people: for who can judge this thy people, \add that is so\add* great?

And God said to Solomon, Because this was in thine heart, and thou hast not asked riches, wealth, or honour, nor the life of thine enemies, neither yet hast asked long life; but hast asked wisdom and knowledge for thyself, that thou mayest judge my people, over whom I have made thee king:

wisdom and knowledge \add is\add* granted unto thee; and I will give thee riches, and wealth, and honour, such as none of the kings have had that \add have been\add* before thee, neither shall there any after thee have the like.
Then Solomon came \add from his journey\add* to the high place that \add was\add* at Gibeon \add to\add* Jerusalem, from before the tabernacle of the congregation, and reigned over Israel.
And Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen: and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, which he placed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
And the king made silver and gold at Jerusalem \add as plenteous\add* as stones, and cedar trees made he as the sycomore trees that \add are\add* in the vale for abundance.
And Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt, and linen yarn: the kingâ€™s merchants received the linen yarn at a price.

And they fetcht up, and brought forth out of Egypt a chariot for six hundred \add shekels\add* of silver, and a horse for an hundred and fifty: and so brought they out \add horses\add* for all the kings of the Hittites, and \add for\add* the kings of Syria, by their means.
